content: I miss the 8-day battery of my Garmin, but the Pixel Watch 4 charges quickly. I like the Spigen case.
Moving from Epix Gen 2 to Pixel Watch 4 45mm. The screen size is larger, which is helpful.
I'm getting a PW4 and appreciate this post. I'll read dcrainmaker's review later today for more info.
I'm wearing both my mechanical and Pixel watches. I find pros and cons for each one.
I hope Google makes a tougher watch like the Apple Watch Ultra in the future for rugged users.
I'm held back by navigation. I want to load routes for outdoor activities, which is a must.
Accidental crown presses happen during pushups, but adjusting watch position fixes it. Voice sensitivity can be adjusted.
Thanks for the well-written, comprehensive review! It's really appreciated and very informative for users.
The always-on display should work for timers. It's annoying to wave my wrist to wake the screen.
I'm pleased native Fitbit tracks swimming laps. Updated to OS Wear 6 but need swim.com.
Your article is better than The Verge's journalism! Can you check active zone minutes on PW3?
I wear mine with the crown facing my shoulder to prevent accidental bumps, especially when lifting weights.
I can tap to pay without double-pressing the crown with the default card set in wallet.
I upgraded from the 2 to the latest. The always-on display is awesome and the battery is great!
I jumped from PW2 and am very happy with the new pixel watch, it really feels nailed on.
My Pixel Watch's HR monitor stopped working after the warranty, and the back fell off. Google hardware isn't well-made.
Amazing review with praise, constructive feedback, real-life use, and interesting flow. Rating it a perfect 10/10.
Upgraded to Pixel Watch 4. Interested in Fitbit sleep tracking. Is Fitbit Premium needed for sleep states chart?
I don't like the domed display Spigen case helps. Battery and watch faces are great so far.
Accidental button presses mean the watch is too close to your hand. Wear it closer to the elbow.
This review is too long, but I love the watch. However, I don't agree with your design gripes.
DC Rainmaker's Pixel Watch review shows it's simple, lacking in-depth sports features for hardcore athletes.
Reviews say battery life and biometrics are better. Overall, it seems a solid update addressing previous complaints.
I'm waiting for the Unlocker and Michael Fisher's detailed reviews before making any decisions.
I'm tempted to switch from my Galaxy S21 to a Pixel because of good trade-in values offered by Google.
Thao Huynh also posted a video review of the Pixel 7 Pro.
Does anyone know if they fixed the 4K 60fps audio problem when recording loud videos?
Mr Mobile's Google Pixel 7 Pro review highlights the refining of the reinvention, a solid phone.
Mrwhosetheboss review of Google Pixel 7 & 7 Pro - labels the release as Ridiculous.
My 45mm Pixel Watch 3 arrived today! I love the bigger size/display. Watchband connector is frustrating though.
I've tracked GPS walks, workouts, controlled media, and sleep cycles. Hitting about 30% battery at 24 hours.
I'll buy when there's an interesting discount. I miss Wear OS features after moving to a dumber watch.
Is it just me, or is that design ugly? The corners are odd, looks like marble teddy bear eyes.
A day and a half battery is a pro now? I'll keep my Garmin lasting 10-12 days.
Hoping they make analog-looking watches like the GT4 in the near future. Improvements are a good sign.
I'm scared this watch will be too big on my hand, Apple watch 44 was already on the edge.
Pixel Watch 2 shows only 3 exercises. I cycle between 4. Has this been fixed in the 45mm Pixel 3?
Disappointed in no LTE support in Europe. Samsung watches support LTE without issues, so this is bad.
I upgraded from 2 to 45mm 3 and love the bigger screen. Battery lasts 2 days with AOD on.
Battery life of 1.5 days is bad. OnePlus watches last a week. Why can't others implement that?
Two days battery is "right"? Garmins last at least a week for same price range with similar features.
Original Pixel Watch drained 45% over 24 hours with AOD off. Could go 2 days without charging though.
Excited for a 45mm watch again and decent battery life. The shrinking of the bezel is also a plus.
Google makes it hard to sell their hardware with the Fitbit paywall. They should support Fitbit without this.
Happy with basic Fitbit features, don't miss premium. Battery life is disappointing, will wait for gen 2.
The new Pixel Watch is beautiful and perfect size. It looks responsive and not ugly like others.
They had a decade to work on smartwatches and failed first released, like Pixel phones. Pixel 7 refined though.
Does P7 Pro location update smoothly in real time while driving? My Pixel 6 Pro jumped around.
Does the camera still oversharpen everything in portrait mode? The pixel 6 overprocessed compared to older versions.
My selfie camera stopped loading. Restarting doesn't work. Do I need to reboot the system to fix it?
How long for the update to download? Been downloading for 30m and can't tell if I need to reset.
Comparing to Galaxy Watch demos, the Pixel Watch is pretty smooth, which gets me excited for a unit.
I see nothing wrong with the overall design. A watch is normally a fashion product after all.
Internet people simply repeat what they hear without critical thought or consideration about the topic.
Battery life is a red flag. The watch is too small for good battery life, despite the appeal.
I wish it looked more like a watch. I have been buying Galaxy Watches for the classic look.
Battery is only a day, which is bad. Functionality is sleep-related, so those two aspects are not good.
More worried about the software. Google uses us as paying beta testers for their buggy software often.
Pixel Watch is too small, battery isn't great, and uses old hardware. For $350, it's not a good deal.
I'm waiting for more reviews on the watch before buying one because I need more details about it.
The Pixel Watch 3 is a great companion. I love the Fitbit stats, and it feels the smartest watch I've ever used.
The Pixel Watch 3 in the larger size finally feels perfect on my wrist. I don't want to take it off.
The Google Pixel Watch 4 is a significant leap in Google's smartwatch lineup. The domed display is nice.
This watch is amazing and it replaced my Pixel Watch. I have been using it non-stop since I got it.
I think the Google Pixel Watch 4 is probably the best Android smartwatch right now, it finally catches up to the competition.
The Pixel Watch 4 is smarter, prettier, and longer-lasting, but it's still not built for outdoor activities, which is unfortunate.
I have been using the Google Pixel Watch 4 45 mm. I think this watch is amazing and I will continue using it.
The Google Pixel Watch 3 is the best smartwatch an Android user can buy, it's my daily driver now.
Google Pixel Watch 4 upgrades make this a compelling option if you are in the market for a new smart watch.
The Pixel Watch 4 is bigger, brighter and built around Gemini. I love all the new changes and features.
The Google Pixel Watch 4 is easily the Best Android Smartwatch of 2025. I would recommend it to any android user.
Google finally got it right, especially with the battery life on the Pixel Watch 3. Now it lasts all day.
The Pixel Watch 4 (41mm) is Phenomenal in all ways but one, the watch band is not very good quality.
The Pixel Watch 4 delivers where it matters: longer battery life and better performance, a big upgrade.
The Pixel Watch 3 is one of the most exciting smartwatches of the year. It is a must buy!
After boatloads of runs, rides, swims, I can confirm that everything you need to know about Google's latest watch is amazing.
Google Pixel Watch 3 is a great Early Review and I would recommend buying it if you are in the market for a watch.
Google's Pixel Watch 4 combines luxury features like satellite connectivity and advanced GPS with Gemini and has a capable voice assistant.
Review: The new Pixel Watch 4 is a true runners' watch. But is it worth upgrading from the last gen?
The Pixel Watch 3 is great! It has a faster processor, improved battery life, and a sleeker design.
The Pixel Watch looks great and is suited to many use cases. It arguably looks better than other watches.
The Pixel Watch 3 delivers a refined user experience with a faster processor and better battery life.
The Pixel Watch 3 delivers a refined user experience with a faster processor and a sleek design.
The Google Pixel Watch is a smarter Fitbit, priced at $349.99, and Google's first Wear OS smartwatch.
If you are on a pixel phone, the pixel watch is a good choice. It's a very good pairing.
The Google Pixel Watch is definitely worth buying! I recommend it.
